lines.text: Eh, what's up, Doc?
I got a little rabbit in this hole. And I gonna catch the little rabbit and eat him up. Eeeeee!
A little rabbit? wouldn't you rather have a big rabbit?
Er... Yeah!
Well here I am. Take me.
Mmmm, num, num, slurp

[Slaps pete's hands]
Take your dirty mitts off of me! What do you think you're doing?
But you told me to, you told me to, you told me to!

[Hands Bugs a cigar]
How 'bout having a cee-gar
Gee thanks
[sniffs cigar]
Mmmm, nice.
[Sees it's an El Explodo cigar; Pete presents Bugs with a light, but Bugs puts the cigar in his pocket]
Well, I think I'll have to be goin' now.
Oh, no, you can't leave yet. You got to have a nice cup of tea with me.
[Drags Pete to a table]
Here we are.
[Serves tea]
There's nothing as sociable as a nice cup of tea, I always say. How many lumps do you want?
Oh, three or four

[Bugs bunny whacks Pete on the head with a mallet 5 times and 5 lumps appear on his head]
Oh dear, I gave you one too many. Well we can fix that.
[whacks the 5th lump back in his head]
There, and here's a cigar for you.
[Bugs shoves the cigar in Pete's mouth and lights it; Bugs runs away; 3 seconds later it explodes]

[Disguised as a lady rabbit]
Darling, come to mother. I'm the little feller's mother, and I've been so worried about him. Eeeeee!

[Really fast]
No, no, no! She's not my mother! She's not even my aunt! Don't let her take me! Don't let her take me!
Uh-uh, Junior. It ain't polite to talk back to your mother.
[Winks]
Hee-hee-hee-hee! I get it! I get it!
Come on home with mother, darling. Mother's going to have a wonderful dinner.
[Runs with Shorty, but Bugs grabs him by the tail]
Oh, no, don't go yet, Mrs. Rabbit. You must have a cup of tea with me first.
But I don't think...
Oh, it's no trouble at all, Mrs. Rabbit.
[Brings a tea tray]
Here we are. Tea's on.
But I don't want no tea. It gives me a headache.
Okay, well, what shall we have, then?

[Takes out a coffee pot]
Coffee! Eeeeee!
Okay, we'll have coffee. Eh, how many lumps do you want?
Oh, three or four.
[Bugs hits him with mallet as before, but Pete has an Acme stovelid on his head; Bugs takes out his Acme stovelid lifter to remove lid; lumps come out, Pete faints]
I thought I'd better see you home, Shorty, on account of I don't trust that sneaking puma any more than I can throw the Big Mo.

[Disguised as puma]
Howdy, cousin!
I know you.
Sure you do. I'm your second cousin, Paul Puma. I just dropped by for a little social call, cos. Say, mighty tender-looking little rabbit squab you got there.
Uh... yeah!
Well, what are we waiting for? Let's start the fire and fricassee him. You start the kindling and I'll get the coal. Uh, by the way, how many lumps do you want?
Oh, better get me a lot of lumps. A whole lotta lumps.
[Realizes it's Bugs; grabs the mallet]
Oh, no, you don't! I'll help myself.
[Starts hitting himself on head with mallet]
Come on, Shorty. We'd better get out of here. He's much too smart for us. Eeeee!
